comments.body: Shouldn't this only be called if the set_options in line 145 was never called? Otherwise strings behind a dictionary entry would overwrite the options provided in the dictionary.
yes ... i made comments to that effect, but this is only way i saw of keeping backwards compat
Can this happen at all, since you added `type: list`?
not for the config route, but yes for the 'inline dict' .. again keeping backwards compatibility here.
But the inline dict route now also uses the config manager.
sorry, inline string, not dict .. this lookup allowed for many bad ways of specifying params

Hmm, I still don't see where that should happen :) Right now, `_split_on` is only called on the results of `self.get_option('files')` and `self.get_option('paths')`, so only for data that went through ConfigManager.

they can still be inline strings at that point, since it was allowed before, it is only way to continue to allow for that

files and path CAN be a list or can be char separated string, in the case of paths 2 chars, in files 3 (but , is taken care of automatically by type: list, so just need the other 2)

```- hosts: localhost
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
  - name: test legacy formats
    set_fact: hatethisformat={{item}}
    vars:
      params:
        files: not/a/file.yaml;hosts
        paths: not/a/path:/etc
    loop: "{{ q('first_found', params) }}"```

Didn't see a comment about this, but something like this would now work
```
files:
  - not/a/file.yaml;also/not.yml
  - nope.yml;hosts
paths: /etc
```
... need to deprecate the 'custom separators' as soon as i can ...
